meanings.definition: The part of a sundial that casts a shadow.
meanings.sent1: The gnomon on the sundial helped people tell time.
meanings.sent2: She studied the gnomon to understand how sundials work.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the gnomon as a tiny umbrella.
meanings.sent4: His tall shadow stretched out like a gnomon on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The sharp edge of the gnomon cut through the sunlight, marking the hours.

meanings.definition: An object or figure used to form a right angle.
meanings.sent1: He used a gnomon to make sure the corner was perfectly square.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter carefully measured the angles with a gnomon.
meanings.sent3: The playful cat knocked over the gnomon, creating chaos in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her strict teacher's gaze was like a gnomon, always keeping watch.
meanings.sent5: The gnomon stood upright, guiding the construction of the new building.
